etymologies: early 19th century (in an earlier sense). From French pérule scaly covering of a leaf-bud and its etymon scientific Latin perula (Mirbel, in the same source, II. 635) from classical Latin pēra (from ancient Greek πήρα leather bag, wallet) + -ula

definitions: Originally: the scaly covering of a leaf bud. Later: a bud scale (usually in plural).
